name: delicatessen
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(informal deli) a small shop that sells high-quality foods, such as types of cheese and cold cooked meat, often from other countries, and, especially in the United States, sandwiches made using these foods: Smoked sausage can be found in most delicatessens. Have you tried that Greek deli on Church Street?
Hispanolistic/E+/GettyImages
(usually deli, deli counter) a counter in a supermarket where you can get different types of cheese, cold cooked meat, prepared salads, etc. : The new store will have a pharmacy inside, along with a delicatessen, bakery, and seafood department. Ask for our sliced ham at the deli counter.
monkeybusinessimages/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesI got the cheese from one of Paris's top delicatessens.Baklava can be bought in many good bakeries and delicatessens. New York's Jewish delis are famous throughout the world.We went to get lunch from the deli.There was a long line at the deli section.
